newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Hwa Hong in Indonesia toll road project.
newsitem.headline: Hwa Hong in Indonesia toll road project.

text.p: Hwa Hong Corp Ltd said on Wednesday it had entered agreements with two firms linked to Indonesian businessman Ir Fadel Muhammad to build a Singapore $510 million toll road in West Java.
Hwa Hong also said in a statement that a company linked to the group will apply for a listing prior to June 1998.
Hwa Hong said the unit listed could be its wholly-owned subsidiary Singapore Piling & Civil Engineering Pte Ltd, or another company with ties the project.
The project involves the financing, final engineering design construction, operation and maintenance of a 53.5 kilometre section of toll road which runs from Ciawa to Sukabumi.

Hwa Hong's statement said the project will entail a joint venture comprising Indonesian government-owned Persusahaan Perseroan (Persero) PT Jasa Marga and two companies in which Ir Fadeal Muhammed has substantial stakes, Bukaka Asia Investments Pte Ltd and PT Bukaka Teknik Utama.
The joint venture, PT Bukaka Marga Utama, has received a concession from PT Jasa Utama to operate the toll road for 24 years and eight months, excluding the construction period of about three years.
Bukaka Asia and Bukaka Teknik are expected to contribute about S$51 million each and hold a 40 percent stake in the joint venture. Jusa Marga will contribute about S$25.5 million and hold 20 percent.
Hwa Hong said it would acquire from Ir Fadel Muhammed an 80 percent stake in Bukaka Asia.
In exchange, Ir Fadel Muhammed will through the new issue of Singapore Piling shares obtain a 24.9 percent stake in the share capital of Singapore Piling.

In addition, Singapore Piling and PT Bukaka Kujang Prima, in which Ir Fadel Muhammad has a substantial stake, have agreed to set up a joint venture construction firm to undertake civil and structural engineering works in Indonesia and the region.
